data.title: Scottish Agenda: David Smith: Its a state of emergency but the games not over
data.meta_description: Unfortunately, the bang was followed by a whimper. Vis never managed to finish the sequel and entered an ill-fated marriage to Bam! Entertainment, a Californian games publisher with its own cash flow
data.text:
Unfortunately, the bang was followed by a whimper. Vis never managed to finish the sequel and entered an ill-fated marriage to Bam! Entertainment, a Californian games publisher with its own cash flow problems. Vis’s long-expected collapse into administration this weekend will prompt all the usual wailing and gnashing of teeth about Scotland’s inability to grow global companies. How sad, too, that van der Kuyl should be maligned for being an ambitious young upstart who tried, and tried again.

The bigger picture is that the computer games industry is, and always will be, impossibly tough. Developers depend on upfront payments from publishers to fund the long, exorbitant and labour-intensive process of creating new games.
